intro: Collaea tomentosa, commonly known as the silky collaea, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, soft appearance. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or heathland environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
